name: places/ChIJD4-XQOVYwokR1SmzAN1gCbY
formattedAddress: 293 Mott St, New York, NY 10012, USA
adrFormatAddress: 293 Mott St, New York, NY 10012, USA

editorialSummary.text: Opulent, designer-run shop for unique, fashion-forward men's casual & dress clothing & accessories.

originalText.text: The store is fun, salesperson Michael (Mike?) is lovely, Jay Kos appears attentive and responsive. But after making some measurements and pretending to agree to custom-make a suede overall in ways that would address how the one in the store did NOT work for me, they took my money then just mailed me the one from the store. I paid $200 where I live to have a few alterations done but some of the issues a new pair would have addressed are not possible through altering this size. The store has some amazing things! If you love something at the store, buy it. If you want something made or adjusted to your liking, don't count on it or trust the promises - even for the very high prices that should justify the effort they may claim to be willing to make.

originalText.text:
Timeless unique pieces that decree I take my sense of style seriously. If your personality is classic but modern this is the place to procure your look.
Trousers, jackets, sports coats, leather and now beautiful hats.

Not common to see a family man with such a grounded spirit, and an even better sartorial eye. This review is solely on Jay Kos the experience. Discovered the store a couple years ago, and Jay treats you without judgement.

Whilst his pieces may not be for the fur lovers I can warrant you all his sourcing is by the man himself and jay only does biz with good peeps. Keep up the good work Mr.K

originalText.text: Horrible store selling animal fur with a complete disregard for the lives of innocent beings. Directly supporting the mass murder and torture of animals is not a "business", it is the lowest of low, the worst possible representation of humanity. Disgusting company.

text.text: Horrible store selling animal fur with a complete disregard for the lives of innocent beings. Directly supporting the mass murder and torture of animals is not a "business", it is the lowest of low, the worst possible representation of humanity. Disgusting company.

originalText.text: Unbelievably bad customer service. Also the merchandise is totally average and not very well-made. John Varvatos is 2 blocks away with much better stuff.

originalText.text: Jay Kos it's very nice and stylish with an artistic soul
